tables.questionText: How would you describe your specialty/training?
tables.baseText: Asked of respondents who indicated Internal Medicine / General Practitioner / Primary Care / Family Practice as their specialty
tables.userNote: (Select all that apply)

tables.questionText:
You are about to enter a market research survey. We are being asked to pass on to our client details of adverse events about individual patients or groups of patients and / or product complaints that are raised during the course of market research surveys. Although this is a market research survey, and what is contributed is treated in confidence, should you raise an adverse event and / or product complaint, we will need to report this even if it has already been reported by you directly to the company or the regulatory authorities. In such a situation you will be contacted to ask whether or not you are willing to waive the confidentiality given to you under the market research codes of conduct specifically in relation to that adverse event and / or product complaint. Everything else you contribute during the course of the survey will continue to remain confidential.

Are you happy to proceed on this basis?

rows.label: I would like to proceed and protect my identity
I would like to proceed and give permission for my contact details to be passed on to the Drug Safety department of the company if an adverse event is mentioned by me during the survey

tables.userNote: (Selecting "I don't want to proceed" terminates the survey.)

changes: s5: labels — Updated all row labels to verbatim survey answer text for S5 (multi-select screener).

s5: exclude — Flagged table for exclusion (move to reference sheet). Rationale: S5 is a screener where selections 1–6 were termination criteria; among qualified/completing respondents this question will be effectively trivial (dominant 'None of these').
s5: nets — Did NOT create an 'Any affiliation (NET)' because such a NET would be trivial (near-zero) in the qualified sample; avoided creating a meaningless NET.
s8: labels - Replaced coded row labels with verbatim survey text for S8 rows; added user note clarifying autosum and screener qualification.
s8: no_change - Kept as mean_rows (do not modify numeric summary rows; system will compute mean/median/std).

s8_S8r1_distribution: derived - Created a derived frequency table for S8r1 showing a 3-bin distribution (70-89, 90-99, 100) because meta distribution is highly skewed and this view aids interpretation.

{"tableId":"s12","action":"labels","description":"Found S12 in SCREENER. Updated questionText to the verbatim question (without prefix). Simplified row labels to match survey text and added a userNote and baseText clarifying the numeric counts and the sum constraint. Kept table as mean_rows." }

{"tableId":"s12_total","action":"nets","description":"Added derived mean_rows NET '_NET_S12_TOTAL' that sums S12r1-S12r4 to provide a respondent-level total patients with an event (system will compute mean/median/std dev for this synthetic row)." }

{"tableId":"s12_total_binned","action":"split","description":"Added derived frequency table for the total (bins: 0, 1-20, 21-70, 71-500) using quartiles from the provided metadata (q1=20, q3=70) to give analysts a binned distribution view of respondent totals." }

a3: Found in SECTION A. Updated questionText to verbatim survey wording and cleaned row labels to match survey answer text. Kept as mean_rows (summary stats will be generated downstream). Added a user note to clarify response format (counts out of last 100; rows can sum to >100).
a3_A3r1_bins: Added derived frequency (binned) table for A3r1 (Statin only). Bins: 0, 1-25, 26-50, 51-75, 76-100.
a3_A3r2_bins: Added derived frequency (binned) table for A3r2 (Leqvio). Bins: 0, 1-11, 12-22, 23-33, 34-45 (matches variable's allowed range).
a3_A3r3_bins: Added derived frequency (binned) table for A3r3 (Praluent). Bins: 0, 1-25, 26-50, 51-75, 76-100.
a3_A3r4_bins: Added derived frequency (binned) table for A3r4 (Repatha). Bins: 0, 1-15, 16-30, 31-45, 46-60 (matches variable's allowed range).
a3_A3r5_bins: Added derived frequency (binned) table for A3r5 (Zetia/ezetimibe). Bins: 0, 1-23, 24-47, 48-71, 72-95 (matches variable's allowed range).
a3_A3r6_bins: Added derived frequency (binned) table for A3r6 (Nexletol/Nexlizet). Bins: 0, 1-12, 13-25, 26-37, 38-50 (matches variable's allowed range).
a3_A3r7_bins: Added derived frequency (binned) table for A3r7 (Other). Bins: 0, 1-5, 6-10, 11-15, 16-20 (matches variable's allowed range).

Notes: No NET rows were created because these are counts out of 100 that can overlap across therapies (NETs would be ambiguous/trivial). No exclusions applied; question is in-scope and shows meaningful variance.

{"tableId":"a3a","action":"labels","description":"Found A3a in Section A. Updated questionText to the full survey wording; simplified and standardized row labels to 'Therapy — [In addition to statin / Without a statin]'; added a user note clarifying these are percentages of the 'last 100' patients and that each therapy row sums to 100%. Kept table as mean_rows (numeric percent); no NETs or splits added."}

a3b: Found in survey (SECTION A). Kept original mean_rows table but cleaned and shortened labels to match survey product names and the two columns (Before / After). Added baseText and userNote. (Action: labels, no_change to mean_rows content).

a3b: Added five derived frequency tables (isDerived=true), one per therapy (Leqvio, Praluent, Repatha, Zetia, Nexletol/Nexlizet). Each derived table bins the percent responses into 0, 1–15, 16–50, 51–100 to surface the many zero/low values (meta shows median=0, q3=15). (Action: split, binned distributions).
a3b: Did not create NETs (not applicable for numeric percent variables). Did not exclude the question (meaningful variance exists though skewed). (Action: no_nets, no_exclude).

a4: Found in survey (A4). Cleaned labels to match survey answer text, split the original 7×2 mean_rows matrix into two derived mean_rows tables (a4_last100 and a4_next100) for readability, and excluded the original overview table (moved to reference sheet).

a4_last100: Created derived mean_rows table containing variables A4r1c1–A4r7c1 (LAST 100 reference values). Added userNote and tableSubtitle; labels updated to concise therapy names. sourceTableId = a4.

a4_next100: Created derived mean_rows table containing variables A4r1c2–A4r7c2 (NEXT 100 under assumed FDA indication change). Added userNote and tableSubtitle; labels updated to concise therapy names. sourceTableId = a4.
a4a: labels - Rewrote variable labels to match survey product names and clarified column meaning ('In addition to a statin' vs 'Without a statin').
a4a: no_change_to_type - Kept tableType as mean_rows (numeric percent responses); downstream summary stats (mean/median/stddev/min/max/base) will be provided automatically.
a4a: note_added - Added userNote clarifying that the two columns per therapy sum to 100% and that values are percentages of NEXT 100 patients.
a4a: exclude_check - Determined table should not be excluded (meaningful variation present; distribution meta available).

a4b: Found in survey (Section A). Converted cryptic datamap labels into clear product × timing labels (5 products × 2 timing columns). Kept as a mean_rows table (numeric % distributions). Added baseText noting conditional display and a userNote clarifying that 'Before' + 'After' sum to 100% per therapy. No NETs, T2B, or splits created.
a6: Excluded original flat ranking table and cleaned labels. Reason: split into derived ranking views for readability (Rank 1 comparison, Top-2 comparison, and per-item detail tables).
a6_rank1: Created Rank 1 comparison table (one row per treatment path showing respondents who ranked the item #1). Labels updated to match survey text. (Derived from a6)
a6_top2_comparison: Created Top 2 (NET) comparison table (one row per treatment path showing share ranked 1 or 2). (Derived from a6)

a6_detail_A6r1–a6_detail_A6r8: Created per-item detail tables (for each treatment path) showing Top 2 (NET) and full rank distribution (ranks 1–4). Subtitles reflect the treatment path. (Derived from a6)
Labels: Replaced long autogenerated labels with concise survey text for A6r1–A6r8.

Notes: A6 is a ranking question (rank up to 4). Derived Top-2 NETs were added for easy comparison. The original flat table was excluded to keep published sheets scannable; excluded table is retained on reference sheet.
a7: labels - Replaced generic/verbose autogenerated labels with verbatim answer text from the survey for A7r1-A7r5.
a7: nets - Created multi-variable NET row '_NET_A7_AnyImpact' (Any impact (NET)) combining A7r1-A7r5 to show percent selecting any option. Component rows indented under the NET.
a7: derived - Marked table as derived since a NET row was added. Added user note indicating multi-select format and that sums can exceed 100%.
a8: Found in survey - A8 is a 5 (patient situations) × 3 (products) grid with a 5-point likelihood scale (1=Not at all likely → 5=Extremely likely).

Action: Replaced the flat 75-row overview with an excluded original (moved to reference) and created derived tables for analysis: one T2B comparison table grouped by patient situation and five per-situation detail tables showing the full 5-point distribution for each product.
Labels: Updated row labels to include product names and clarified T2B rows ("Very or Extremely likely (T2B)"). Scale labels standardized to survey wording.
T2B: Created Top-2-Box NET rows using filterValue "4,5" for all product×situation combinations. Component rows (5 and 4) included in per-situation detail tables (indent=1).
Readability: Split into 1 concise comparison table (15 T2B rows grouped by situation) + 5 readable detail tables (~18 rows each) to keep each table scannable.
Excluded: Original flat overview table (a8) marked exclude=true and moved to reference sheet (replace rather than delete).

a9: Found in survey — A9 is a 3-item matrix asking about issues (coverage, approvals, cost, etc.) for Repatha, Praluent, Leqvio when used without a statin. Scale labels confirmed from datamap (1=No issues; 2=Some issues; 3=Significant issues; 4=Haven't prescribed).
a9_any_issues_comparison: Created a 3-row comparison table showing 'Any issues (NET)' across products (NET = values 2 and 3). This gives a single, easy-to-scan metric for cross-product comparison.

a9_repatha_detail / a9_praluent_detail / a9_leqvio_detail: Created per-product detail tables (one for each product) with a rollup 'Any issues (NET)' (2,3) and the component rows (Some issues, Significant issues) indented under it; 'No issues' and 'Haven't prescribed without a statin' are shown as standalone rows. Labels updated to match survey text.
a9 (original): Excluded the original 12-row flat overview (moved to reference sheet) because the comparison + detail tables present the same information in more analyst-friendly, scannable views.
Notes: Added userNote '(Any issues = Some issues or Significant issues; Select one for each product)'. All derived tables reference sourceTableId 'a9'.

tableId: a10, action: nets, description: Updated row labels to match survey text; added a multi-variable NET row '_NET_A10_AnyReason' combining A10r1-A10r5 to show 'Any reason for prescribing PCSK9s without a statin (NET)'. Left A10r6 ('Haven't prescribed PCSK9s without a statin') as a standalone row. Added user note '(Select all that apply)'. No exclusion applied.

b1: split - Converted the original flat frequency-by-value table into a mean_rows summary (b1_mean) with one row per insurance type and a derived binned frequency table (b1_binned) to show distributions by range. Labels were updated to match survey text.

b1_mean: labels - Condensed to a mean_rows table (one row per B1 item). Updated labels to the exact answer text from the survey and added a user note reminding that respondents allocated percentages that should sum to 100%.

b1_binned: split - Created a derived frequency table with readable bins per insurance type (grouped by header rows). Bins were chosen based on each variable's allowed range in the datamap to give analysts distribution detail without 200+ rows.
b5: labels - Replaced verbose datamap labels with exact survey option text for B5r1-B5r5.
b5: nets - Added multi-variable NET (_NET_B5_Any) aggregating any selection across B5r1-B5r5; components indented under the NET.
b5: derived - Marked table as derived (added NET) and added userNote and baseText to clarify context.

s1: labels & nets - Located S1 in the SCREENER section; fixed truncated option 2 label to match survey wording; added a same-variable NET 'Proceed (NET)' combining options 1 and 2 (filterValue = "1,2") with the two component rows indented; added user note clarifying that selecting 'I don't want to proceed' terminates the survey. Table kept (not excluded).

s2b: labels - Cleaned question text (removed numeric prefix) and verified labels against datamap; set surveySection to SCREENER and added userNote '(Single response; 'Physician' groups physician specialties)'. No NETs, T2B, splits or exclusions were created (table is a simple frequency).

s2 | nets & labels: Found S2 in the SCREENER section. Removed question-number prefix from questionText and aligned it to the survey verbatim. Added two same-variable NET rows to aid analysis: 'Physicians (NET)' (filterValue '1,2,3,4,5') with component rows for 1-5 indented beneath it, and 'Advanced Practice Providers (NET)' (filterValue '6,7') with components 6-7 indented beneath it. Kept 'Other' (99) as a standalone row. Added userNote indicating that some responses trigger routing/termination. No exclusion applied.

s2a: labels verified and matched to survey wording; added required row fields (isNet, netComponents, indent). Marked surveySection as SCREENER and added baseText/userNote clarifying conditionality. No NETs or rollups created (not applicable). Table retained as a simple 3-row frequency table.

qcard_specialty: no_change - No NETs or T2B created (categorical, only 2 groups); table remains small and readable.

qspecialty: labels - Replaced abbreviated codes with full survey answer text (Cardiologist; Internal Medicine / General Practitioner / Primary Care / Family Practice; Nurse Practitioner / Physician Assistant).

s3a: labels - Confirmed labels match survey and removed question prefix from questionText.

qtype_of_card_reference: exclude - Added an excluded reference header row summarizing datamap value labels for auditing purposes.
qon_list_off_list: Updated labels to readable forms (expanded CARD/PCP/NPPA; clarified ON-LIST as priority accounts).
qon_list_off_list: Overview excluded (moved to reference) in favor of two derived, more-analytical tables.

qon_list_off_list_on_vs_off: Created On-list and Off-list NETs with provider-level components (useful for analyzing recruitment priority vs non-priority).
